content:
Do we have somewhere a list of the 820 or 822 implications that hold for finite magmas but not infinite ones (the uncertainty coming from whether 677→255 for finite magmas)? I wasn't able to extract it from existing files:

  • on the dashboard the link extract_implications –json –closure –only-implications –finite-only gives a 404 missing file error;

  • trying to use lake exe extract_implications --finite-only directly gives me confusing output, cf issue n°1245.

Assuming that extract_implications only needs to be completed by including dual implications, I think I determined the list of finite equivalences between general equivalence classes. This is already useful to check that commentaries on Austin pairs etc are correct and complete.

63: [1692]
65: [1491]
73: [125, 229]
115: [2707]
118: [222, 274]
124: [1924]
206: [1648]
219: [880]
261: [2061]
271: [1895]
477: [1492, 3150]
481: [1496, 3161]
504: [910, 1925]
511: [714, 2338]
680: [1695, 2947]
707: [1316, 2940]
883: [2101, 2304]
917: [1729, 2541]
1086: [1898, 2710]
1096: [1133, 1167]
1113: [2534]
1117: [2538]
1289: [2507, 3116]
1323: [1526, 2744]
1519: [2128]
1523: [2132]
1656: [1659, 1661]
1722: [2737, 3143]
3588: [3994]

Here is the list of 820 finite implications: finite_implications.txt. Most of them are just consequences of the new equivalences, but some are not: finite_implications_short.txt. I'm working on pointing out this info to the commentary. We may want to keep the list of 820 finite implications somewhere more visible. Blueprint? Dashboard?
Blueprint plus a link in the paper seems reasonable. If it's not set to auto-update then the dashboard doesn't seem appropriate.
Bruno Le Floch has marked this topic as resolved.
